author: Natalie Andrews
title: A Leader of GOP’s Freedom Caucus Weighs Run for House Speaker
text:
| WSJ Pro WASHINGTON—A leader of a group of the most conservative House members said Friday he is exploring a run to succeed outgoing Speaker Paul Ryan, adding a new dimension to what so far has been a two-way race.

“I’ve had colleagues encourage me to consider it and I’m open to that,” said Jim Jordan, an Ohio Republican and a founder of the House Freedom Caucus, in an interview. The two-time NCAA wrestling champion and conservative firebrand co-founded the caucus in January 2015 as a way for the conservative members to push an agenda... RELATED VIDEO House Speaker Paul Ryan: This Year Will Be My Last After announcing Wednesday that he will not seek re-election, House Speaker Paul Ryan explained how he came to the decision and fielded questions on whether his retirement could signal a grim outcome for the GOP in upcoming midterm elections. Photo: AP
